meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>fake</kanji> and the verb vocab version is similar, it means <vocabulary>to lie</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to cheat</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to deceive</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: Someone tries <vocabulary>to lie</vocabulary> to you. You can't believe it. <reading>It's wha</reading>t (いつわ)??? You can't believe it.
